abstract: Google’s executives have secured the use of a NASA-run airstrip that is just minutes from their offices.
snippet: Google’s executives have secured the use of a NASA-run airstrip that is just minutes from their offices.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 12 — In the annals of perks enjoyed by America’s corporate executives, the founders of Google may have set a new standard: an uncrowded, federally managed runway for their private jet that is only a few minutes’ drive from their offices.

headline.main: Google Founders’ Ultimate Perk: A NASA Runway
headline.print_headline: Google Claims Ultimate Perk: NASA Runway

abstract: Google is putting solar cells on its roof. But is it abdicating its eco-friendly posture on the screen?
snippet: Google is putting solar cells on its roof. But is it abdicating its eco-friendly posture on the screen?
lead_paragraph: Google is putting solar cells on its roof. But is it abdicating its eco-friendly posture on the screen?

abstract: Google’s billionaire founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin are intensely private about their private jet, which recently secured landing rights at Moffett Field. And tracking the reconditioned Boeing 767-200 is not easy.
snippet: Google’s billionaire founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin are intensely private about their private jet, which recently secured landing rights at Moffett Field. And tracking the reconditioned Boeing 767-200 is not easy.
lead_paragraph: Google’s billionaire founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin are intensely private about their private jet, which  recently secured landing rights at Moffett Field. And tracking the reconditioned Boeing 767-200 is not easy.
